title: Open source matlab toolbox for three-dimensional ultrasound imaging
abstractText: This EPSRC Overseas Travel Grant will start a new international collaboration between the Department of Medical Physics and Bioengineering at the University College London (UCL) and LabTAU of the Institut National de la Santé et de la Recherche Médicale (INSERM; Lyon, France). The collaboration will result in the development of the world's first open-source Matlab toolbox for acquiring three-dimensional (3D) ultrasound images, and the application of this toolbox to two specific problems: validation of numeric models of ultrasound wave propagation through heterogeneous biological tissue, and visualisation of High Intensity Focused Ultrasound (HIFU) lesion formation through ultrasonically-induced Lorentz force measurements.
impactText: The findings obtained as part of this grant have been used to develop new methods for performing medical ultrasound imaging and to track the positions of medical devices inside the human body.
findingsText: With this grant, a new set of software tools for conducting research with medical ultrasound imaging was developed. The developments will be used by other medical imaging researchers to perform research on ultrasound and photoacoustic imaging, with a view toward improving our ability to visualize structures within the human body.
